name: oauth-client

signRequest.name: signRequest
signRequest.comment:
Signs oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.request using consumer token oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.consumerToken and user authorization oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.userToken

If the body of oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.request has content type application/x-www-form-urlencoded, then the request body cannot be streaming as the body parameters are required as part of the signature.

The combination of oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.consumerToken, oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.userToken, oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.nonce and oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.timestamp must be unique. oauth/oauth-client.signRequest.timestamp must be specified in Unix time format (i.e. seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00Z)

produceAuthorizationHeader.name: produceAuthorizationHeader
produceAuthorizationHeader.comment: Produces a correctly formatted Authorization header given a parameter map

generateParameters.name: generateParameters
generateParameters.comment: Generate the parameters to be included in the Authorization: header of a request. Generally you should prefer use of oauth/oauth-client.signRequest or oauth/oauth-client.Client

class.name: Token
class.preview: Bundles together the public and secret portions of an OAuth token.

class.name: Client
class.preview: An implementation of oauth/oauth-client.BaseClient which signs all requests with the provided credentials.

packageIntro:
An implementation of OAuth 1.0a, as per RFC 5849.

The client portion is designed for use with the http package. The server portion is designed to work with the dart:io HttpServer class.

Supports only HMAC-SHA1 signatures. In practice, RSA-SHA1 signatures are rare and most users have switched to OAuth 2. PLAINTEXT signatures are also not supported, and hopefully less common.

Comes with a test suite. Please report any incompatibility issues.
